intro: [WRONG START] Umbilicus vulgarus subsp. erectus, commonly known as the common bladderwrack, is a species of seaweed belonging to the family Fucaceae. It is characterized by its dark brown, leathery fronds that are often ribbed and have a distinctive, inflated structure resembling a bladder. This plant thrives in intertidal zones, where it attaches to rocks using a holdfast. It plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms. The plant is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of alginates for industrial applications.
